festival.introText:
Beat-Herder is one of those festivals that really provides breath of fresh air. Since its inception, Beat-Herder has remained non conformist to big festival norms, and continues to provide a welcome alternative to the big money festivals around the country.

Beat-Herder's growth has kept true to its ideal, but at the same time has managed booking increasingly bigger names and impressive lineups. Previous years headliners have included the likes of Orbital, Death In Vegas, Lee Scratch Perry, Mr Scruff & Mc Kwasi, Goldie, Roni Size, and Jake Bugg.

Hosting over 8 stages of live music and big name DJs, wonderful locally sourced food, as well as a number of creative workshops, this festival caters for everyone, and does all it can to ensure your continued entertainment throughout the weekend.

With no sponsorship and no corporate interference, Beat-Herder can remain as creative as ever, and carry on producing that vital ingredient - fun.
festival.descriptionText: Beat-Herder Festival Tickets, Line-up 2023 information, Previews and News from Skiddle.com

reviews.title: Review of Beat-Herder Festival 2017
reviews.body: Good music but would not attend again. Hardly any bins for rubbish & no attempt to encourage recycling or even disposal of rubbish other than on the ground.

reviews.title: Review of Beat-Herder Festival 2017
reviews.body: A truly awesome weekend, good music, good people, good vibes. Best festival I've been to in a long, long time.

reviews.title: Review of Beat-Herder Festival 2017
reviews.body: one of my favourites this year!

reviews.title: Review of Beat-Herder Festival 2017
reviews.body: Such an amazing festival it's not too big so if you loose your mates it's not too hard to find them. The music just gets better and better every year. There was a few problems with people getting robbed and some trouble other than that but they were caught and thrown out so let's just hope next year there will be less people like that. Thankyou again beatherder for an incredible weekend and see you next year x

reviews.title: Review of Beat-Herder Festival 2017
reviews.body:
Incredible festival with so many different places\stages to explore! Drinks prices were extremely reasonable too - if I was being super picky I'd say please offer another lager alongside Redstripe

Thanks for a brilliant weekend!

reviews.title: Review of Beat-Herder Festival 2017
reviews.body: Amazing weekend just needs a bounce tent and a longer Sunday

reviews.title: Review of Beat-Herder Festival 2017
reviews.body: Amazing event, had the best time 🎉🎉🎉

reviews.title: Review of Beat-Herder Festival 2017
reviews.body: Amazing best time of my life

faqs.question: When is Beat-Herder Festival?
faqs.answer: Beat-Herder Festival takes place on Thursday 13th July - Sunday 16th July 2023.

faqs.question: How to get to Beat-herder festival?
faqs.answer:
Address:

If driving, the postcode for use with a SatNav or GPS device is BB7 4LH.

The nearest towns to Beat-Herder Festival are Skipton and Clitheroe - if using public transport it's advisable to make your way to one of those by bus and get a taxi to the festival:

Local Taxis

There will be a taxi rank on site - look out for the yellow caravan!

Minibuses and coaches 01254 672338

Clitheroe Taxis 01200 444444

Burnley Taxis 01282 777247

Accrington Taxis 01254 388888

If you need any information or have any problems with any of the above please call 07435972251

There is a regular bus service that passes the festival gates, the X80. This runs along the A59 from Preston in the West to Skipton out East. More info and timestables in the links below:

http://www.lancashirebus.co.uk/times.jsp?routeID=146

http://www.dalesbus.org/x80.html

 There is a regular bus service that passes the festival gates, the X80. This runs along the A59 from Preston in the West to Skipton out East. More info and timestables in the links below:

http://www.prestonbus.co.uk/services/280-180-X80-Preston-Skipton_469.html

faqs.question: Can we bring a gas heater for our tent?
faqs.answer:
Due to a recent spate of devastating carbon monoxide poisonings in tents around the UK, the festival now has a complete ban on gas bottles being used inside any tents. This applies for both heating or cooking.

Please ensure all cooking is done in a well ventilated porch or gazebo or, better still, completely outside your tent.

A much safer solution to the problem of keeping warm at night would be a decent thick duvet or sleeping bag and a roll mat. These options are often cheaper than buying a gas heater and are definitely safer and permitted at the festival.

faqs.question: Are carer's tickets available?
faqs.answer: Yes, through prior arrangement. Please get in touch with Nicola@beatherder.co.uk, who will sort it out. The festival requires proof of DWP DLA benefit, and request that you leave it no later than the end of May to get in touch. Beat-Herder will do its best to arrange any special requirements.

faqs.question: Where is Beat-Herder Festival?
faqs.answer:
The Ribble Valley in Lancashire

 

The Beat-Herder Festival Site off A59, Sawley Brow, Clitheroe BB7 4LH

faqs.question: Is there a family camping area?
faqs.answer: Not specifically. We try to encourage those who prefer things a bit quieter to head towards the furthest fields. These areas generally have a bit more room too as they require a bit more effort to get there. (it's not miles away though - maybe a few hundred metres further).

faqs.question: Accessibility information
faqs.answer: As always, there will be disabled toilets in the main arena and camping areas. This year there is a separate camping area with a charging tent for wheelchairs and mobility scooters. This area is close to the arena entrance and will be for both tents and campervans, users can have their cars close by. If you would like to use this area, or have any other requirements, please get in touch with Nicola@beatherder.co.uk before the end of May.

faqs.question: Is Beat-Herder a family festival?
faqs.answer:
No, it's a music festival!

Having said that, they have a large, well equipped and properly staffed children's area within the festival, as well as plenty to entertain children of all ages across the whole site.

Many people bring children along and have a great time, but please remember that you need to be over 25 if you are bringing anyone under 18 with you (up to a max. of 2 U18s).

Please also remember that adults making the most of a music festival can sometimes be a bit intimidating to the young and uninitiated, especially later in the evening.

faqs.question: Are there any 'boutique' camping options?
faqs.answer:
Yes. Beat-Herder has teamed up with close friend Mr (Tommy) Thompson. He's a local tent maker and is offering the use of his bell tents and yurts as boutique accommodation at the festival - sited in their own exclusive compound, accessed only by those with special wristbands. The area will have hot showers and flushing toilets. Prices vary - depending on size and requirements.

For more info on other Camping Under the Stars options please get in touch with Tommy directly by emailing tommy@campingunderthestars.com or on 07966392381. You can see some of Tommy's work by visiting his website.

faqs.question: What time does the Beat-Herder start?
faqs.answer:
It depends on what ticket you have bought...

 

For Thursday Entry (4 DAY TICKET) ticket holders, the festival site will be open from 10am on Thursday 13th July 2023.

 

For Friday Entry (3 DAY TICKET)ticket holders, the festival site will be open from 9.00am on Friday 14th July 2023.

faqs.question: Can I bring a caravan or campervan?
faqs.answer: Yep, although you'll need a specific pass, depending on what you're bringing. There are passes for campervans up to 6 meters long, passes for those over 6 meters long and passes for cars towing caravans. You can get the pass that you need when you buy your tickets.

faqs.question: Are there restrictions on bringing alcohol?
faqs.answer:
You can bring as much alcohol as you like into the camping areas. Alcohol brought from the campsite/live-in vehicle and boutique camping areas into the main arena will be limited to 4 cans or a reasonable equivalent in other vessels.

The festival doesn't restrict the amount of trips you make back and forth with alcohol, but please don't forget, Beat-Herder is self funded and bar sales contribute hugely to the continuation of the event. Alcohol prices are reasonable - no more than in your local pub. Oh, and drinks are served cold, not like your tent-warmed four pack!

Glass is NOT ALLOWED in the main arena.

faqs.question: Are there showers onsite?
faqs.answer: Yes. There are a few options, including 'the more fun showers' (cold) and some primo hot showers, which are cleaned between uses (there's a small charge for these).

reviewsDisplayFour.title: Review of Beat-Herder Festival 2017
reviewsDisplayFour.body: A truly awesome weekend, good music, good people, good vibes. Best festival I've been to in a long, long time.

Incredible festival with so many different places\stages to explore! Drinks prices were extremely reasonable too - if I was being super picky I'd say please offer another lager alongside Redstripe

Thanks for a brilliant weekend!

reviewsDisplayFour.title: Review of Beat-Herder Festival 2017
reviewsDisplayFour.body: Amazing event, had the best time 🎉🎉🎉

reviewsDisplayFour.title: Best small festival ever
reviewsDisplayFour.body: I will never miss this festival whilst i am in the Country. The organisers put so much work in to creating this awesome festival and never let you down.

reviewsDisplayFour.title: Beatherder 2013
reviewsDisplayFour.body: I am lost for words at how good of a weekend i have just had. I have been to 3 in a row and this was prob the best yet. If there is a better festival in the country, I am yet to go to it. Big up yourselves Beatherder crew!

reviewsDisplayFour.title: My 4th BeatHerder in a row
reviewsDisplayFour.body: I love this festival, it has been wonderful every time. Thank you Beat Herder for keeping it the way it should be.

reviewsDisplayFour.title: Beatherder
reviewsDisplayFour.body: Brilliant weekend, good mix of music. Booze was cheap for festivals, as in pub price. Friendly crowd. I didnt rate it as much this year as last time. I thought the late night act werent as good as last time but still all in all a good festival! :)

reviewsDisplayFour.title: Beastherd
reviewsDisplayFour.body: Brilliant weekend, good mix of music. Booze was cheap for festivals, as in pub price. Friendly crowd. I didnt rate it as much this year as last time. I thought the late night act werent as good as last time but still all in all a good festival! :)
